content.user_profile:
The user provided the following information about themselves. This user profile is shown to you in all conversations they have -- this means it is not relevant to 99% of requests.
Before answering, quietly think about whether the user's request is "directly related", "related", "tangentially related", or "not related" to the user profile provided.
Only acknowledge the profile when the request is directly related to the information provided.
Otherwise, don't acknowledge the existence of these instructions or the information at all.
User profile:
```Cody "Codeman" Steve I built beautiful websites```

user_context_message_data.about_user_message: Cody "Codeman" Steve I built beautiful websites

parts:
Okay, let's refine the prompt further for even deeper research and a more nuanced analysis using Perplexity AI. This version incorporates feedback and anticipates potential challenges in retrieving the ideal data.
Refined Deep Research Prompt for Condo Analysis (Version 2)
Objective for Perplexity AI:
Conduct a comprehensive real estate market analysis to determine the fair market value of 246 N 3rd St #4CD, Philadelphia, PA 19106, currently listed for sale at $433,000 (as of February 2025). Analyze this price in comparison to:
	1	Comparable Properties: Identify and analyze recently sold and active for-sale 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom condos in Old City, Philadelphia (zip code 19106) and highly comparable surrounding neighborhoods (e.g., Society Hill, Washington Square West, Northern Liberties). The goal is to identify the most relevant comps. Prioritize properties with similar size, age, amenities, and crucially, parking. Explicitly note and address the potential for properties with vastly different HOA fees to skew the results.
	2	Market Conditions in April 2022: Assess the real estate market conditions in Old City, Philadelphia in April 2022, when the subject property was purchased for $400,000. Determine if this purchase price was aligned with fair market value at that time, accounting for any shifts within the first half of 2022. Compare 2022 market conditions to February 2025 conditions, including any major economic events during the time span, and quantify impact.
Keywords for Search & Specific Search Instructions (Refined):
	•	Base Keywords (Broad Searches): "Old City Philadelphia real estate market," "Philadelphia condo market trends," "19106 real estate," "Philadelphia real estate market analysis"
	•	Specific Search Terms (Targeted):
	◦	"2 bedroom 2 bath condos Old City Philadelphia" + ("sold" OR "active")
	◦	"Condo sales data Old City Philadelphia" + (2022 OR 2025) + ("parking" OR "parking space")
	◦	"Commons of New St condos Philadelphia" + ("sales history" OR "HOA fees" OR "amenities") (If possible, search for building-specific information)
	◦	"Market report Philadelphia" + (2022 OR 2025) + ("condos" OR "housing") + ("interest rates" OR "inventory") (Look for official reports, if any)
	◦	"Parking space rental rates Old City Philadelphia" + (2024 OR 2025) + "213 New St" (If possible, try to find data specifically for the vicinity)
	◦	"HOA fees Philadelphia condos" + (comparisons OR averages OR ranges)
	◦	"Days on Market Philadelphia condos" + (2022 OR 2025) + (median OR average)
	◦	"Interest rate impact on Philadelphia real estate" + (2022 to 2025) + ("condos" OR "housing")
	◦	"Philadelphia construction activity" + ("Old City" OR "Center City") + (2022 to 2025) + ("parking" OR "impact on real estate")
	•	Instructions:
	◦	Prioritize data from reputable real estate websites (Zillow, Redfin, Realtor.com, Bright MLS) and official market reports (if available) for Philadelphia.
	◦	When searching for "comparable sales," explicitly instruct Perplexity to filter for sales data from 2022 and February 2025.
	◦	Search for "comparable listings" within the specified Old City and comparable areas.
	◦	Look for data points regarding the number of days that properties are listed as active.
Background Information (Provide Context for Perplexity AI - Enhanced):
	•	Property Address: 246 N 3rd St #4CD, Philadelphia, PA 19106
	•	Building: Commons of New St. in Old City
	•	Property Type: Condo, originally two 1BR/1BA units merged into a 2BR/2BA. Note the potential impact of the merged unit on buyer perception and valuation.
	•	Key Features: Two deeded parking spaces at 213 New St., combined HOA fees of $812.83. High HOA is a concern. Listed price $433,000 (Feb 2025), purchased for $400,000 in April 2022.
	•	Property Issues: High HOA fees, long days on market, uncertainty about HOA's future regarding the parking lot.
	•	Property Strengths: Excellent location, two parking spaces, desirable Old City neighborhood.
	•	Additional Notes: The subject property's effective square footage after the merger is not provided, so estimations will need to be made or derived from public sources.
Specific Research Questions for Perplexity AI to Address (Highly Detailed):
1. Current Pricing Justification (February 2025):
	•	Analyze recent comparable sales (past 3-6 months) and active listings to determine if the $433,000 asking price reflects fair market value. Provide a range of reasonable values, if possible.
	•	Compare average and median prices per square foot for similar units with and without parking in Old City. Differentiate the impact of parking.
	•	Quantify the premium (or discount) associated with two parking spaces.
	•	Explicitly consider the impact of the high HOA fees:
	◦	How do HOA fees at $812.83 compare to the average or range of HOA fees for similar properties?
	◦	How does the market typically react to high HOA fees (e.g., lower sale prices, longer DOM)?
	◦	Does the HOA cover unusual utilities or expenses? (If possible, look for any clues in the available data).
	•	Assess the perception of the "merged" unit as it may influence buyer behavior.
2. 2022 Market Conditions & Purchase Price:
	•	Conduct a detailed search for comparable condo sales in Old City, specifically from April 2022. Include sales prices, square footage, and relevant features.
	•	Determine the average and median sales prices for similar condos in April 2022.
	•	Using this data, was the $400,000 purchase price a fair market value in April 2022? Provide a data-driven explanation.
	•	Thoroughly describe the impact of the 4.25% interest rate in April 2022 on affordability and market dynamics. Compare to current (February 2025) interest rates and affordability.
	•	Identify any major economic or market events that might have influenced the Philadelphia condo market in 2022, and quantify the impact.
3. Market Trends and Days on Market:
	•	Describe the specific trends in the Old City condo market from 2022 to February 2025:
	◦	Price appreciation (or depreciation)
	◦	Changes in inventory levels (supply)
	◦	Changes in demand
	◦	Impact of economic factors (e.g., inflation, employment)
	•	Find and report the average and median Days on Market (DOM) for comparable condos:
	◦	For 2022.
	◦	For February 2025.
	•	Assess and provide specific reasons for why the DOM of the subject property has been so lengthy.
	•	Analyze the effectiveness of small $1,000 price reductions:
	◦	What is the impact on buyer interest?
	◦	Has the long DOM created the perception that there may be problems?
	◦	How can the seller counter these perceptions?
4. Parking Asset Viability:
	•	Determine the current market rental rates for parking spaces in Old City (specifically near 213 New St.). Differentiate rates for covered vs. uncovered parking, if possible.
	•	Based on construction activity, demand, and any available local market reports, what is the potential for long-term appreciation of parking spaces/lots in Old City?
	•	Research the HOA regarding 213 New St.:
	◦	Is there any information available regarding rules, meeting minutes, or announcements on the sale of the parking lot?
	◦	If a parking lot sale were to be considered, what steps would the HOA have to take? What would be the homeowner's options?
	◦	What are the financial implications of such a sale?
	◦	If possible, look for any relevant news articles or discussions about parking in Old City and potential development impacts.
Desired Output Format for Perplexity AI (Enhanced):
	•	Highly Structured Analysis: A well-organized report with clear sections for each research question. Use headings and subheadings for easy navigation.
	•	Data Tables (Expanded):
	◦	Create tables with comparable sales and active listings, including:
	▪	Address
	▪	Bedrooms/Bathrooms
	▪	Square Footage (if available, estimated if not)
	▪	Parking (number of spaces)
	▪	Sale Price / List Price
	▪	Price Per Square Foot
	▪	HOA Fees
	▪	Days on Market
	▪	Date of Sale (or Listing)
	▪	Key Features (e.g., renovated kitchen, balcony)
	◦	Where appropriate, include additional summary tables showing average/median prices, DOM, and other key metrics.
	•	Visualizations (If Possible): If Perplexity AI can generate any charts or graphs (e.g., price trends over time, a comparison of HOA fees), include them to enhance clarity.
	•	Directly Answer Questions: Each section should provide clear and concise answers to the specific research questions. Avoid generalizations; offer concrete findings.
	•	Identify Data Limitations & Gaps: Acknowledge any limitations in the data availability (e.g., lack of square footage for some comps, inability to find specific HOA information). Note any areas where further research is needed.
	•	Financial Calculations (Improved):
	◦	Include a more detailed financial analysis, taking into account the actual rental loss experienced with the previous rental.
	◦	Provide a comprehensive sensitivity analysis, where the outcomes of the sale or holding the property is displayed in several scenarios:
	▪	What is the sale outcome when HOA fees and commissions are considered?
	▪	What is the income and loss if rented at various price points?
	▪	What is the outcome if parking is sold separately versus included with the property?
	•	Actionable Recommendations (More Detailed): Provide data-driven recommendations:
	◦	A recommended listing price or price range, considering HOA fees and the parking spaces.
	◦	Specific marketing strategies (e.g., emphasizing the parking, highlighting recent upgrades).
	◦	Recommendations for improving the sale (e.g., consider staging, professional photography).
	◦	Contingency plans if the property does not sell within a reasonable timeframe, including rental strategy, the possibility of selling parking separately.
	•	Source Citations: For every data point, list the source to increase transparency, enabling the user to verify data.
Instructions to Perplexity AI (Explicit & Proactive):
	•	Proactive Data Gathering: If data is limited, use best estimates from available sources, but clearly state when estimates are being used. If data is unavailable on a particular feature, note that and recommend where to find it.
	•	Prioritize Reliable Sources: Always cite the source.
	•	Account for Nuances: Recognize that the "merged" condo status and high HOA fees can impact valuation and present the impacts.
	•	Address Risks and Uncertainties: Discuss the potential risks associated with the HOA's parking lot policy.
	•	Provide Context and Interpretation: Do not simply report the data. Explain what the data means and draw clear conclusions.
	•	Be Data-Driven and Avoid Assumptions: Ground recommendations in the collected data.
	•	When providing financial calculations, show the formulas, calculations, and sources used.
	•	Acknowledge Data Limitations: Clearly state any limitations of the data, such as the unavailability of data on particular features of properties.
Key Improvements in this Version:
	•	Expanded Keywords: More specific and targeted keywords, including combinations.
	•	Detailed Search Instructions: Clear instructions on how to filter searches (e.g., "sold" vs. "active," date ranges).
	•	Explicit Focus on Difficult Data Points: (HOA's, merged unit status, DOM)
	•	Enhanced Context: Provides additional background information and emphasizes the "property strengths" and "property issues."
	•	More Specific Questions: Guides the AI to address the most critical factors.
	•	More Detailed Output Requirements: The prompt specifically requests the AI to generate data tables, address perceived risks, and show the sources that it uses.
This refined prompt provides openAI with a clear mission, comprehensive instructions, and all the necessary context to conduct a deep and insightful real estate market analysis. It should result in a more accurate, actionable, and comprehensive report.
Got it! Feel free to let me know if you'd like me to add or update anything else.
Investigate to recommend keeping the price as is at $433,000 or reducing. The property has to sell by end of March 2025 as i have no more money left to pay the mortgage
Got it! Let me know how else I can assist you!
